candidates.title: Add example showing how to handle empty vs missing query params
candidates.body: As discussed in discord. I think it makes sense to have an example for this so we have something to link to when people ask.

candidates.title: Remove `Sync` requirement from response bodies
candidates.body:
As we learned [in Tonic] bodies don't need to be `Sync` because they can
only be polled from one thread at a time.

This changes axum's bodies to no longer require `Sync` and makes
`BoxBody` an alias for `UnsyncBoxBody<Bytes, axum::Error>`.

Also cleans up some body error trait bounds and a few misc other bounds
I noticed while cleaning this up.

[in Tonic]: https://github.com/hyperium/tonic/issues/117

candidates.title: Depend on tower 0.4.10
candidates.body:
axum uses `impl Layer for ServiceBuilder` internally which requires
tower 0.4.10. Making that explicit should help users updating to axum
0.3 without also having to manually bump their tower dependency.

candidates.title: Rework docs
candidates.body:
This reworks axum's docs in an attempt to make things easier to find. Previously I wasn't a fan of those docs for the same topic were spread across the root module docs and more specific places like types and methods.

This changes it such that the root module docs only gives a high level introduction to a topic, perhaps with a small example, and then link to other places where all the details are. This means `Router` is now the single place to learn about routing, and etc for the topics like handlers and error handling.

candidates.title: Add HTTP proxy example
candidates.body: Shows how to combine an HTTP proxy with an axum server.

candidates.title: Update to matchit 0.4.4
candidates.body:
- Static vs dynamic paths are now supported meaning `/foo` and `/:key`
  are not considered to overlap.
- A bug we hit regarding trailing slashes is fixed.

candidates.title: Add `MatchedPath` extractor
candidates.body: Fixes #386

candidates.title: "matchit" based router

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: A PR with an enhancement

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: A PR that makes a breaking change.

candidates.body:
- Routing is now done by [matchit](https://crates.io/crates/matchit) internally.
- Adds support for wildcard routes namely things like `.route("/foo/*, _)`.
- Performance stays the same as you add more routes. I've benchmarked 1, 10, and 100 routes and saw no significant increase in response times.
- Overlapping routes now cause a panic when being added.
    - This doesn't work across `or`s since `or` takes any `tower::Service`. I think thats fine and want to keep `or` this general.
- `nest` still accepts any `tower::Service` which is how I think we should keep it.
- The order routes are added in no longer matter.
- Doesn't change method routing.

## TODO

- [x] Update changelog
- [x] Document panics from `route` and `nest` when adding conflicting route
- [x] `nest` cannot contain wildcards because axum internally makes it a wildcard
- [x] Document `/foo` and `/:key` now conflicting
- [x] Does cloning `Node` impact performance?
- [x] Look into if this fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/380#issuecomment-941051980
- [x] Make sure middleware still only apply to the routes defined above

Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/240
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/259
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/109

candidates.body: This is a breaking change because it changes the API surface for users who use `default-features = false`.

candidates.title: Expose hyper's http2 feature flag
candidates.body:
## Motivation

So you don't have to depend on hyper explicitly to enable this feature.

## Solution

What the title says.

## Notes

I think the the http1 feature on hyper should be made optional in axum 0.3.0, but be part of the `default` feature set, so users can opt into http2-only operation.

candidates.title: Version 0.2.3
candidates.body:
# 0.2.3 (26. August, 2021)

- **fixed:** Fix accidental breaking change introduced by internal refactor.
  `BoxRoute` used to be `Sync` but was accidental made `!Sync` ([#273](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/273))

candidates.title: Revert "Remove buffer from `BoxRoute` (#270)"
candidates.body:
This reverts commit 552d69e5d4af638c92a262d4d9e55334cb061226.

It turns out that #270 made `BoxRoute` `!Sync` which made one of our project's at Embark not compile. Gonna revert, publish new release, and then yank.

candidates.title: Version 0.2.2
candidates.body:
# 0.2.2 (24. August, 2021)

- **fixed:** Fix URI captures matching empty segments. This means requests with
  URI `/` will no longer be matched by `/:key` ([#264](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/264))
- **fixed:** Remove needless trait bounds from `Router::boxed` ([#264](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/264))

candidates.title: Remove buffer from `BoxRoute`

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

candidates.body:
Boxing a service normally means using `tower::util::BoxService`. That
doesn't implement `Clone` however so normally I had been combining it
with `Buffer` to get that.

But recently I discovered https://github.com/dtolnay/dyn-clone which
makes it possible to clone trait objects. So this adds a new internal
utility called `CloneBoxService` which replaces the previous
`BoxService` + `Buffer` combo in `BoxRoute`.

I'll investigate upstreaming that to tower. I think it makes sense there
since box + clone is quite a common need.

chosen_pr.title: Expose hyper's http2 feature flag
chosen_pr.body:
## Motivation

So you don't have to depend on hyper explicitly to enable this feature.

## Solution

What the title says.

## Notes

I think the the http1 feature on hyper should be made optional in axum 0.3.0, but be part of the `default` feature set, so users can opt into http2-only operation.
